Help: Fields

Fields are used to both describe expected data, as well as specify how that data should be validated.

Clicking the "Create New Field" button will prompt you for a field name, and then create it. If you want to change the name later, click the name to edit it. Click the icon to remove the field.

Fields are comprised of:

  • A "required" flag - is the field required in order to validate?
  • An "allow empty" flag - can the field be a null or empty string and still be considered valid?
  • A "continue if empty" flag - if the field is empty and required, should the validations still be run?
  • One or more validators.
  • One or more filters, used to normalize the field prior to validation.

Validators and filters may be added, manipulated, and removed in the same ways. In each case, you must first Click the icon to expand the input and reveal the "Add Validator" and "Add Filter" buttons. Adding either will reveal a form that allows you to select from available validators or filters.

Validators and filters will be executed in the order in which they appear in the admin tool; you may grab the icon in order to drag and re-order them. Clicking the icon will remove it.

Most validators and filters also support a number of options. After adding one, you may add options; these may be selected from a dialog, and an appropriate form input will then be provided to allow you to specify a value. You cannot edit options after creating them; however, you can remove them via the icon and re-add them with the changes you desire.

For more information on available validators and their options, please see the ZF2 reference guide on validators.

For more information on available filters and their options, please see the ZF2 reference guide on filters.
